input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The IP address or hostname of the name server to use for the query.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">nslookup -query=hinfo ${hostname}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name server}') != 0" /> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${name server}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text>/usr/bin/dig</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name server}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> @${name server} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${hostname} hinfo</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS" os-version="5.8"> <xsl:text>/usr/sbin/nslookup -query=hinfo ${hostname}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name server}') != 0" /> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${name server}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text>/usr/sbin/dig</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name server}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> @${name server} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${hostname} hinfo</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Query a name server and obtain information on the specified host.
